name: The Jefferson Hotel

reviews.text: I always dreamed of staying at The Jefferson and never was able to get a room. My dream finally came true and boy was I disappointed. The common areas and towels are fabulous and it ends there. Furnishings and bedding are poorly appointed and in need of an upgrade. The shower was one of the worst of my life. The shower head had two settings:skin piercing or drip with a temperature setting of luke warm or scalding. All options ended up with the oh so nice "face spray". On check in the toiletries had not been changed from the previous guest. I believe a 5 star rating should imply that all the rooms carry a high standard and the one I was in clearly did not live up to this expectation. I have stayed at the Berkeley Hotel in Richmond and had a nice shower and a comfortable sleep, for a similar price. The only bright spot is they are pet friendly. However, unless I bring my dog I will not stay at the Jefferson again. (I was not in a "pet room" on this trip)
reviews.title: Not worth 5 stars

reviews.text: This is possibly the best hotel I've ever stayed at. Arriving, I was kindly greeted by a doorman at the awesome wooden doors that open themselves!!! As I walked in, the lobby was amazing and huge, with that huge stained-glass dome in the ceiling!!! We checked in at the front desk, and I must mention the service couldn't have been better. The employee at the front desk upgraded our standard room to a studio suite. We proceeded to our room. We all were very impressed with our huge studio suite! It was clean, but there might have been one unnoticeable stain on the carpet that is nothing to be concerned about. We only stayed for one night, but for that time, we were very impressed with the Jefferson Hotel!
reviews.title: A Wonderful, Elegant Retreat!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is rated as a 5 star hotel for a reason...it's fantastic. The ambiance is wonderful and honors the history of the hotel. The staff is so friendly and eager to help. TJs was delicious and welcoming even when we arrived late at night. We asked if there was an upgrade for the same price we were quoted on the phone and they were able to comply. Unlike other hotels, I was amazed how quiet the room's heat fan was. This is always a problem for me but didn't even think about it while trying to sleep. Would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Elegance, charm and wonderful service!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Jefferson on their Valentine's Day Package. We had a lovely room with a view of the city. They think of everything; they even have heaters at the entrance, to keep you warm while you are waiting for their van. Yes, they have vans that will drive you around the city. In our case, they took us to the wine festival at the convention center. Just call them when you are ready to come back to the hotel.
reviews.title: Romantic, Elegant and Historic Hotel

reviews.text: The conciege service is wonderful, Richmond has so much history, wonderful museums and the recently refurbished capital building.
reviews.title: Wonderful anniversary

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Several members of our family attended a wedding at the Jefferson. It was absolutely lovely. Upon arrival at The Jefferson we were greeted with a smile and very prompt service. This is an historic hotel and as such has features that some might think a bit odd. Not too many hotels feature a full sized statue of Thomas Jefferson in front of the check-in counter! It is obvious that the hotel had been built in stages and perhaps before the advent of elevators. It did take a bit of getting used to the different banks of elevators. But, after a few trips up and down we had the layout of the hotel down pat. Our room was quite spacious, the bed linens and window treatments were of the highest quality and in great condition. The towels were huge and thick! Throughout the hotel, the elaborate woodwork and decor was very well cared for. The pool area was delightful. Lovely teak deck chairs welcomed us with thick fluffy towels folded neatly as well as am immaculate changing rooms and pool area.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel with old Virginia Charm

reviews.text: The wedding itself was amazing. Having the bridal party decend down the grand staircase was truly lovely. The food and service at the reception was first rate. My experience couldn't have been better.
reviews.title: Wraped In Luxury

likes.liked: — Personal service, opulent lobby space, rooms

reviews.title: Affordable comfort
reviews.text: The service at the hotel was impeckable. It was never over the top...but, was sincerely friendly. In fact, we were there on a Sunday when they offer their huge brunch, we had little children with us who were more into an Applebee type of place. When we asked the coincerge if there was such a place nearby, he offered to have a driver take us there....it was just around the corner. My son-in-law got a call from relatives who were dining at a restaurant and one of the party had a bad fall and needed extra bandages. My son-in-law asked the coincerge for the nearest drugstore and again was offered a ride in one of the Jefferson's Town Cars. He was driven to the drug store, the driver waited and then drove him to the restaurant to deliver the bandages then drove him back to The Jefferson. The cost was just a tip!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel's hospitality was outstanding. I will be back!
reviews.title: Nice Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Business took me to Richmond and after seeing an article about The Jefferson, I decided to book the nite there, instead of at the offered hotel. This was the best hotel experience I have ever had (and I've had many). So many times you hear the words luxury and are unsure what that really means. Those hoteliers should take a lesson from The Jefferson.
reviews.title: Made so welcome in a large hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Jefferson. The hotel is beautiful. We arrived Saturday afternoon while many were enjoying tea and a wedding reception was going on. Our room was large, well furnished, and comfortable. The only fault I could find was that the bathroom fan could not quite keep up with the steam from my shower in the morning.
reviews.title: Very nice!

reviews.text: After enjoying a drink at the bar we had a fabulous dinner a LeMaire – try the fried green tomatoes appetizer, and the sea scallops were large and tasty! Breakfast the next morning (part of our package) was a nice buffet served in the ballroom; a lovely setting for a nice buffet.
reviews.title: Family friendly Southern Charm

reviews.text: Service was wonderful throughout the hotel; very friendly, helpful, and not pushy. We’ll be back!
reviews.title: Absolutely charming, wonderful, historic, memorable.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the moment we arrived to the moment we left we were charmed by this Grande Dame. The rooms are beautifully furnished and the public areas are excellently maintained. The location could be better but this is solved by an excellent shuttle bus service that will take you and pick you up anywhere in Richmond. The pool is great and there is a small roof terrace for the sun worshippers amongst you. Our kids were made to feel most welcome and loved the hotel as well, stay here if you visit Richmond.
reviews.title: The place to be to relax after a day in bustling Richmond
Elegant but family friendly
reviews.text: This hotel is steeped in history, and has a spectacular lobby and wonderful ambiance. I travel a lot, but rarely have I experienced the warmth and comfort that this hotel exudes. There is a first class gym and a lovely indoor pool. I also loved the very Southern gift shop and the free coffee service in the lobby each morning. If you are ever in Richmond, this is the only place to stay. We walked around the corner to a restaurant called Comfort and had a great Southern meal and were genuinely happy with every aspect of our three night stay. The Sunday brunch is also not to be missed. Lovely.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: this hotel has the best service i have experienced.they have a shuttle that will take you anywhere in richmond. restaurant is good. but the best part is the room. in particular the bed. it is the most comfortable bed i have slept in in a hotel. this place lives up to its reputation
reviews.title: best bed, great service

reviews.text: Incredible service, beautiful accommodations, excellence down to every last detail. I stayed for four nights in early June and had absolutely no complaints. I would recommend the Jefferson to anyone who is visiting Richmond.
reviews.title: Fantastic experience

reviews.text: We booked a stay at the Jefferson with a "Shoestring Package" - it is an amazing deal. First, the hotel is gorgeous and worth a visit, even if you don't stay there! The deal offers a reduced rate for a room, plus free valet parking, $25 gift certificate, and free breakfast for two. We were upgraded to a fantastic room - with a fireplace and marble bath. The hotel is very well kept and beautiful. They even offer free car service to their guests for areas around Richmond. We couldn't have asked for a better stay. It was amazing! The hotel wasn't terribly busy, so I encourage Richmond travelers to check out this hotel and what it offers. You won't be disappointed!
reviews.title: Excellent Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just amazing service. Travel can often be a hassle, and the staff at this hotel were simply delightful. Would stay here again in a heartbeat! Brunch was really delicious, and a great value with the unlimited champagne.
reviews.title: best service at a hotel-EVER.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I took my husband here for a surprise birthday overnight getaway. I live about an hour from Richmond but we had never been there. So, I planned a romantic overnight with many stops and the Jeff was our home base.
reviews.title: Loved it but not as luxurious as billed

description: Since 1895, The Jefferson Hotel has been recognized for its genuinely friendly service, luxurious guestrooms, breathtaking architecture and elegant decor. Guests of The Jefferson enjoy two award-winning restaurants, 24-hour room service, a complimentary on-site health facility,indoor swimming pool, and complimentary wireless internet access and local calls. Located in the heart of downtown, all of the city's most popular destinations can be reached using the hotel's complimentary transportation.
